Description: 11 new fake crypto-wallet extensions add-ons are discovered in the Chrome Web store.
Trend Micro publishes a list of malicious Chrome extensions making use of a recently discovered technique called "Session Replay" attack.
Google discloses a Chrome 0-day vulnerability exploited in the wild (CVE-2019-13720) within the Operation WizardOpium discovered by researchers from Kaspersky Lab.
Archive Poster, a popular Chrome extension with over 105,000 users has been deploying an in-browser cryptocurrency miner to unsuspecting users for the past few weeks.
A new Windows trojan, CStealer, is discovered that attempts to steal passwords stored in the Google Chrome browser and send then to a remote MongoDB.
Researchers from AdGuard uncover five malicious ad-blocker extensions on the Chrome Web Store that were installed by 20 million Chrome users before Google removed them.
Researchers at MyCrypto discover a malicious Chrome extension able to steal Ledger wallet recovery seeds.

Security researchers from ICEBRG find four malicious Chrome extensions available in the Chrome store, laced with suspicious code, and infecting more than 500,000 users across the globe, including workstations within major organizations.
Researchers from ElevenPath discover a malicious Chrome extension, dubbed Flash Reader, active from February 2018 and downloaded by approximately 400 users.
Google removes YouTube Queue, a Chrome extension that secretly hijacks search engine queries and redirecting users to ad-infested search results. It had been installed by nearly 7,000 users.

Google removes 49 malicious Chrome browser extensions from its Web Store that were posing as cryptocurrency wallets in order to drain the contents of bona fide wallets. The applications were discovered by MyCrypto and PhishFort.
Google removes two malicious Chrome extensions (AdBlock and uBlock) performing "Cookie Stuffing".
Security researchers discover and take down a malicious campaign dating back to 2017, using up to 500 malicious Chrome extensions.

ExtraHop, a real-time IT analytics firm, detects malicious code hidden inside a Chrome estension called Postman, raising concerns about a possible about a possible industrial espionage campaign, being the extension able to collect browsing history.
Google confirms that the reported 0-day Chrome RCE vulnerability CVE-2019-5786 is actively being exploited in the wild by threat actors.

Danielle Lloyd, English model and former Miss England and Miss Great Britain, has her iCloud account hacked, with attackers stealing intimate images that were eventually posted online.

Author: APT28 AKA Fancy Bear
Description: Denmark’s security service, Politiets Efterretningstjeneste’s (PET) Centre for Cyber Security says in its report that Danish armed forces personnel have their emails hacked over the last two years. The hack has been attributed to ‘Fancy Bear'.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security
Tags: APT28, Fancy Bear, Politiets Efterretningstjeneste, PET

Author: Aslan Neferler Tim
Target: Danish Ministries Of Immigration And Foreign Affairs
Description: The Ministry of Immigration and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Denmark, are hit by a DDoS attack thought to have come from a Turkish hacker group dubbed Aslan Neferler Tim.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security
Tags: Aslan Neferler Tim, Danish Ministry of Immigration, Danish Ministry of Foreign Affairs

Description: AFL Women's league player Darcy Vescio Twitter account is hacked.
Datapoint POS appears to have been hacked.

David Beckham's emails are held hostage by hackers, and published after his representatives refuse to pay a ransom of €1 million (£860,000). The ‘Beckileaks' came as part of a breach on sports and entertainment agency, Doyen Global (18.6 million emails apparently accessed in 2015 and 2016).

Author: Ayyıldız Tim
Description: The Turkish Cyber Army hacking group strikes again and hijacks the Twitter account of vocal Donald Trump supporter and ex-Milwaukee County Sheriff David Clarke Jr.
David Nott, a British surgeon who helped carry out operations in Aleppo, reveals that the hacking of his computer could have led to a hospital being bombed by suspected Russian warplanes.
The Davidson County computers are hit by an unspecified ransomware.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: The Davidson County computers are hit by an unspecified ransomware.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: Daytona State College notifies staff of potential W-2 incident

Malware infects the backend systems used by British high street chain Debenhams, and steals 26,000 people's personal information in the process. The hack happened after compromising the systems at Ecomnova, the firm that runs the Debenhams Flowers business, for six weeks.

Decatur County General Hospital in Parsons, Tenn., publicly discloses that an unauthorized party accessed the server for its electronic medical record system and secretly implanted cryptomining malware.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: Deep Hosting, a Dark Web hosting service, admits to have suffered a major security incident during which "some sites have been exported"
The CEO of Defense Point Security, LLC tells all employees that their W-2 tax data was handed directly to fraudsters after someone inside the company got caught in a phisher’s net.
Target Class: M Professional Scientific And Technical Activities

Description: KrebsOnSecurity reveals that a web site set up by PC maker Dell Inc. to help customers recover from malicious software (DellBackupandRecoveryCloudStorage.com) may have been hijacked for a few weeks this summer.

The Guardian reveals that Deloitte, one of the world’s “big four” accountancy firms has been targeted by a sophisticated hack that compromised the confidential emails and plans of some of its blue-chip clients.
Target Class: M Professional Scientific And Technical Activities

Description: Researchers from infosec group Malware Must Die discover a new variant of the Mirai botnet capable of infecting devices powered by ARC CPUs. The botnet is dubbed "Okiru", which means "wake up" in Japanese.
Diagnostic Radiology & Imaging notifies 800 patients of phishing incident occurred in November 2017.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Target: Diamond Institute For Infertility And Menopause
Description: Diamond Institute for Infertility and Menopause notifies patients of an incident involving their electronic health records server, maintained by an unnamed third party. The incident happened in February
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: The Dutch official online signature system DigID is also reportedly hit by the same wave of DDoS attacks.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: The Dutch official online signature system DigID is also reportedly hit by the same wave of DDoS attacks.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: Disqus confirms a data breach that appears to have taken place in the summer of 2012, and during which an unknown attacker(s) made off with details for at least 17.5 million user accounts.

Dixons Carphone has admitted a huge data breach involving 5.9 million payment cards and 1.2 million personal data records. The breach began in July last year and 105,000 cards without chip-and-pin protection have been leaked.
Ankit Anubhav of NewSky Security discovers a U.S. government website hosting a malicious JavaScript downloader, leading victims to installations of Cerber ransomware.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: DocuSign acknowledges that a series of recent malware phishing attacks targeting its customers and users was the result of a data breach at one of its computer systems.

Domino's Australia investigates a potential breach of its computer systems after a number of customers received personalised spam emails from the pizza company. The company claims the breach happened to a "secondary supplier".
Target Class: I Accommodation And Food Service Activities

Description: In the past week, two security firms, Dr.Web and Emsisoft, suffered DDoS attacks at the hands of cyber-criminals who attempted to bring down their websites as payback for meddling with their illegal activities.
Current and former employees’ personal information, including SSN, is acquired by a hacker after an employee falls for what the district describes as a “sophisticated phishing scheme.”
Drake Bell appears to be the most recent victim of hackers as part of another episode of the Fappening saga.
DrayTek, a Taiwan-based manufacturer of broadband CPE devices, announces that hackers are exploiting a zero-day vulnerability to change DNS settings on some of its routers.
DreamHost is hit by a powerful and sustained DDoS attack after briefly hosting a new edition of the neo-Nazi website Daily Stormer.
Researchers from Imperva/Incapsula discover another strain of malware, dubbed Kitty, aimed to exploit Drupalgeddon 2.0 (CVE-2018-7600) to mine cryptocurrency
The Danish state rail operator DSB is hit by a massive DDoS attack, paralyzing some operations, including ticketing systems and the communication infrastructure.
A hacker makes off with at least 6.5 million email addresses and poorly hashed passwords from a Yu-Gi-Oh fan project called “Dueling Network.”
A Dun & Bradstreet 52GB database containing about 33.6 million records with very specific details about each of the people involved from job title to email address is exposed.
Target Class: N Administrative And Support Service Activities

Description: The Dutch Tax Authority is also taken down by a DDoS attack.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: The Dutch Tax Authority is also taken down by a DDoS attack.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: According to local reports in the Netherlands, hackers manage to breach the surveillance camera system in a dressing room of a sauna hosting the women handball team, and post the recordings on adult websites last December.
Concordia’s online course systems, eConcordia and KnowledgeOne, are hacked, 9000 users are compromised.

Author: nclay?
Description: A hacker steals millions of user account details from popular education platform Edmodo, and the data is apparently for sale on the so-called dark web. The organization claims to have over 78 million members.

Author: Russia?
Description: Jeanette Manfra of the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), during her testimony before a Senate panel, reveals that Russian hackers targeted election systems in 21 US states during last year's campaign.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: UK cryptocurrency startup Electroneum is the victim of a DDoS attack immediately after having raised $40m (£30m).

Russian authorities identify a distributed malware campaign targeting electronic gas stations using software programs at the pumps. Dozens of gas stations have been attacked with customers paying more for fuel (around 3 to 7% increment per gallon).
Target Class: D Electricity Gas Steam And Air Conditioning Supply

Description: The personal information of Elmcroft Senior Living residents and their family members, employees and others could have been stolen in a data breach that occurred in mid-May.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: The Sunday Independent reveals that cybercriminals are hacking the email accounts of Irish solicitors in an attempt to steal tens of thousands of euro from unsuspecting home buyers.
Target Class: M Professional Scientific And Technical Activities

Author: Turla
Target: Embassies And Consulates In East Europe
Description: Researchers from ESET unveil the details of a new operation carried on by the Turla cyber espionage group, targeting embassies and consulates in East Europe using a fake Adobe Flash updater.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: Turla
Target: Embassies And Consulates In East Europe
Description: Researchers from ESET unveil the details of a new operation carried on by the Turla cyber espionage group, targeting embassies and consulates in East Europe using a fake Adobe Flash updater.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: Turla
Description: Researchers from ESET uncover Gazer, a new malware tool used by the infamous threat actor Turla to spy on embassies and consulates in Europe.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: APT28 AKA Fancy Bear
Description: The same reports reveals that French presidential candidate Emmanuel Macron was targeted by APT28.

Author: Russian Hackers?
Description: French front-runner Emmanuel Macron calls for the European Union to stand firm against Russia as his French election campaign is targeted by computer hackers. The Kremlin denies any allegations.

The French presidential candidate Emmanuel Macron is targeted by a “massive and coordinated” hacking attack, hours before voters go to the polls. Tens of thousands of internal emails and other documents (9Gb) are released online.
Target Class: N Administrative And Support Service Activities

Description: Emory Healthcare is one of the victims of the MongoDB ransomware attacks and has its database, managed by a third-party and containing 90,000 records encrypted.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities
Tags: Emory Brain Health Center MongoDB, Ransomware

Author: Suspected Russia-backed hackers
Target: Energy Networks Of The Baltic States
Description: Reuters reports that Suspected Russia-backed hackers have launched exploratory cyber attacks against the energy networks of the Baltic states.
Target Class: D Electricity Gas Steam And Air Conditioning Supply

Description: Another attack exploiting an Initial Coin Offering. As much as $500,000 in ether is stolen from supporters of the Enigma blockchain project following a security compromise. Attackers are able to take control of the project’s website domain, one of the administrator accounts on its Slack channel and its mailing lists. Once in control, the attackers distribute solicitations for an initial coin offering "presale."
Entergy notifies employees of a W-2 breach involving the TALX portal (a wholly-owned subsidiary of Equifax). The breach involves 2016 W-2 data.
Target Class: D Electricity Gas Steam And Air Conditioning Supply

Description: Entergy notifies employees of a W-2 breach involving the TALX portal (a wholly-owned subsidiary of Equifax). The  breach involves 2016 W-2 data.
Target Class: D Electricity Gas Steam And Air Conditioning Supply

Author: Chafer
Description: Researchers from Symantec reveal the detalils of an Iranian hacking outfit, dubbed Chafer, previously focused on domestic surveillance, expanding its scope and cyber arsenal to target entities across the Middle East.

Security researchers at Palo Alto Networks uncover a new cyber espionage group tracked as RANCOR that has been targeting entities in South East Asia, using two previously unknown strains of malware dubbed DDKONG and PLAINTEE.

Target: Entities Perceived By The Chinese Government As Dangerous.
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 discover a new malware family dubbed Reaver linked to SunOrcal malware and targeting entities perceived by the Chinese Government as dangerous.
Tags: Palo Alto Networks, Unit 42, Reaver, SunOrcal, China

Description: Threat Intelligence firm GreyNoise discovers that a mysterious attacker is scanning the Internet for EOS blockchain nodes that are accidentally exposing private keys through an API misconfiguration.

Equifax reveals the details of an unauthorized access to customers’ employee tax records happened between April 17, 2016 and March 29, 2017. The list of victims includes including defense contractor giant Northrop Grumman; staffing firm Allegis Group; Saint-Gobain Corp.; Erickson Living; and the University of Louisville.
Tags: Equifax, Northrop Grumman, Allegis Group, Saint-Gobain Corp., Erickson Living, University of Louisville

Description: Equifax, reveals to have been hit by a data breach could potentially affect 143 million consumers in the United States. The breach has been discovered on July 29th.
Equifax says it has removed third-party code from its credit report assistance Web site that prompted visitors to download spyware disguised as an update for Adobe’s Flash Player software.
Security researchers at 360 Core Security detect a new type of attack which targets some Equihash mining pools.

Author: Ayyıldız Tim
Target: Eric Bolling (@Ericbollingtr) And Greta Van Susteren (@Greta) Twitter Accounts
Description: Former Fox News hosts Eric Bolling and Greta Van Susteren appear to have their Twitter accounts hijacked by a group of suspected Turkish hackers dubbed Ayyıldız Tim.

Over 1.5 million user profiles featuring names, email addresses and personal IDs from the eSports Entertainment Association (Esea), a leading competitive videogame community, are leaked online after being hijacked by hackers in late December last year.

Author: Kapustkiy
Description: One of the websites belonging to Venezuela’s ministry of defense (esguarnacpuntademata.mil.ve) is hacked by Kapustkiy in protest of what the attacker described as the dictatorship of President Nicolas Maduro in the country. The attacker leaks 2,100 records.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: Popular cryptocurrency exchange EtherDelta is hacked, with many users unknowingly sending their tokens to the hacker instead of the exchange. At least 308 ETH ($266,789) were stolen, as well as a large number of tokens potentially worth hundreds of thousands of dollars.

Researchers from RiskIQ unveil the details of MEWKit, a sophisticated phishing campaign aimed at stealing credentials of Ethereum wallets, and in the same time, perform and automated transfer with the stolen details.

Researchers from Bitdefender spot a wave of attacks to open SSH connections of EthOS, the operating system of Ethereum-mining farms in the attempt to hijack the funds by replacing the user’s wallet with their one.

Hackers disrupt the Etherparty ICO (Initial Coin Offering) after hijacking the platform's website, displaying their own Ethereum address, tricking 59 ICO participants into sending funds to the wrong wallets.

A UK-based Bitcoin exchange called Exmo ishit by atargeted DDoS attack. The attack happens just days after one of Exmo's leading analysts, a blockchain expert named Pavel Lerner, is kidnapped in Kiev while leaving his office. A $1M bitcoin ransom is paid to release him.

A hacker tricks Experty ICO participants into sending Ethereum funds to the wrong wallet address. He is able to do this by sending emails with a fake pre-ICO sale announcement to Experty users who signed up for notifications. The bounty amounts to $150,000 worth of Ethereum.

Author: Satori Botnet
Description: The operators of the Satori botnet are mass-scanning the Internet for exposed Ethereum mining rigs, according to three sources in the infosec community who've observed the malicious behavior —SANS ISC, Qihoo 360 Netlab, and GreyNoise Intelligence.
Researchers at Trend Micro discover a malicious new cryptocurrency mining malware that specifically targets Facebook Messenger users . The malware has been dubbed as Digmine.
Researchers from security firm F-Secure uncover a phishing campaign spreading via Facebook Messenger and targeting users across Europe including Germany, Sweden and Finland.
Tags: F-Secure, Facebook Messenger, Germany, Sweden, Finland

Description: Kaspersky Lab reveals the details of a new multi platform malware/adware spreading via Facebook Messenger.

Researchers from MalwareHunterTeam discover an information-stealing Trojan, dubbed Socelars, disguised as a PDF reader that steals Facebook and Amazon session cookies as well as sensitive data from the Facebook Ads Manager.

Researchers at Avast report a sophisticated campaign in which attackers use Facebook and Facebook messenger to trick users into installing a highly sophisticated Android spyware. The operation is dubbed Tempting Cedar.

Facebook reveals that "malicious actors" took advantage of search tools on its platform, making it possible for them to discover the identities and collect information on most of its 2 billion users worldwide.

A huge cache (220 million records) of Facebook users' phone numbers and user IDs is found for sale online at the price of $1,000. The list allegedly comes from an unsecured database unearthed two days before.
Researchers from Cyble discover a threat actor selling a database with 267 million Facebook profiles for £500 on the dark web and through hacking forums.
Hackers appear to have compromised and published private messages from at least 81,000 Facebook users' accounts.

Author: Iran-linked attackers
Description: Facebook shuts down 783 Iran-linked pages, groups and accounts from its social media platform that it claimed were promoting misinformation.

Author: Employees of Sputnik
Description: Facebook removes hundreds of pages and accounts linked to employees of Sputnik, a news agency based in Moscow, engaged in political influence campaigns across the Baltics, Central Asia, the Caucasus, and Central and Eastern European countries.

Facebook removes more than 300 fake accounts, pages and groups tied to France and Egypt, including some that posed as news outlets and shared content about various topics including the novel coronavirus.

Facebook, Twitter and Instagram remove multiple accounts and pages for a coordinated inauthentic behavior on behalf in Ghana and Nigeria on behalf of individuals in Russia, targeting primarily the United States.
Facebook removes 200 pages, groups and accounts designed to mislead people in the Philippines.
Facebook says it shut down hundreds of fake accounts, pages and groups that misled users, including some that used artificial intelligence to generate fake profile pictures.

Author: Archimedes Group
Description: Facebook removes 265 Facebook and Instagram accounts, pages, groups and events involved in inauthentic behavior. The activity originated in Israel and focused on Nigeria, Senegal, Togo, Angola, Niger, Tunisia, Latin America and South East Asia.
Family Planning NSW tells customers their personal information may have been compromised after the not-for-profit fell victim to a ransomware attack. Around 8,000 users might be affected.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: Family Services Rochester notifies individuals that portions of its computer systems that contained personal information has been compromised by ransomware.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Author: APT28 AKA Fancy Bear AKA Sofacy
Description: Researchers at Kaspersky Lab reveal a new analysis on the infamous APT28 indicating that the group is shifting its interest to Far East Targets
A 2016 data breach leaves Fashion Fantasy Game, an online game and social network for fashion lovers, with millions of user account credentials being leaked on the web.

Fast Health reports a security breach that could affect over 700 of their patients, when a third-party altered a code on their server, stealing the credit card information of close to 700 customers who paid bills online from January 14, 2016 to December 20, 2016.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: The personal details and payment card data of guests from hundreds of hotels, are stolen by an unknown attacker from FastBooking, a Paris-based company that sells hotel booking software to more than 4,000 hotels in 100 countries. The breach occurred on June 14.
FastHealth reveals that in mid-August 2017, an unauthorized party gained access to their web server and obtained patient data.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: 2018 begins with a new round of Fappening leaks. This time the victim is Faye Brookes, whose explicit video is leaked on several video sharing websites.

Author: CyberZeist
Description: Exploiting a vulnerability of Plone CMS, CyberZeist claim to have hacked fbi.gov and leaks the records of 155 FBI officials on pastebin. Plone denies that a 0-day vulnerability has been exploited to carry on the attack.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: OurMine
Target: Fc Barcelona Twitter And Facebook Accounts
Description: The OurMine collective takes over the official Twitter and Facebook accounts of Barcelona and falsely announce the signing of Angel Di Maria from Paris Saint-Germain.
Tags: FC Barcelona, Facebook, Twitter, Angel di Maria, OurMine

Description: The FCC website is hit by a DDoS Attack.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: Rekan Herror
Description: A Kurdish hacker going by the online handle of “Rekan Error” defaces the official website of Fifth Harmony, an American girl group formed on the second season of The X Factor US in July 2012 and posts messages against ISIS.
UK magazine publisher Future's FileSilo website (FileSilo.co.uk) is raided by hackers, who make off with, among other information, unencrypted user account passwords.
Researchers from Trend Micro spot a new variant of the KillDisk disk-wiping malware targeting companies in the financial sector in Latin America.

NCR sends an advisory to its customers saying it had received reports from the Secret Service and other sources about jackpotting attacks against ATMs in the United States. Sources say the malware behind the attack is Ploutus.D.

Target: Financial Organizations In Russia, And Biological And Chemical Threat Prevention Laboratories In Europe And Ukraine.
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky Lab reveal to have detected Olympic Destroyer infections across Europe in May and June 2018. New victims include financial organizations in Russia, and biological and chemical threat prevention laboratories in Europe and Ukraine.

Target: Financial Services Information Sharing And Analysis Center (Fs-Isac)
Description: The Financial Services Information Sharing and Analysis Center (FS-ISAC), an industry forum for sharing data about critical cybersecurity threats facing the banking and finance industries, reveals that a successful phishing attack on one of its employees was used to launch additional phishing attacks against FS-ISAC members.
Target Class: U Activities Of Extraterritorial Organizations And Bodies

Description: Finger Lakes Health is functioning the old-fashioned way while its computer system remains locked up by an unspecified type of ransomware.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: Finger Lakes Health  is functioning the old-fashioned way while its computer system remains locked up by an unspecified type of ransomware.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: Researchers spot a copy of Michael Wolff’s book Fire and Fury infected with malware.
A group of hackers called 31337 leaks a second dump of data allegedly stolen from security company FireEye.
A Firefox extension called Image Previewer is discovered, injecting a Monero in-browser miner into Firefox. While we have seen numerous Chrome.

Mozilla warns Firefox users to update their browser to the latest version after security researchers found a vulnerability that hackers were actively exploiting in “targeted attacks” against users. The vulnerability is indexed as CVE-2019-17026.

Researchers from Malwarebytes discover that tech support scammers are still using an old Firefox bug to lock the screen of their victims' computer in order to convince them to call a bogus Windows support number.

Target: First Forum (Forums.Usfirst.Org) And First Tech Challenge Forum (Ftcforum.Usfirst.Org)
Description: FIRST Forum (forums.usfirst.org) and FIRST Tech Challenge Forum (ftcforum.usfirst.org) notify a data breach.
Tags: FIRST Forum, forums.usfirst.org, FIRST Tech Challenge Forum, ftcforum.usfirst.org

Description: The network of FirstHealth is hit by WannaCry and forced to suspend the operations.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Target: Five Mexican Banks Including No. 2 Banorte
Description: Thieves siphon 300 million pesos ($15.4 million) out of five Mexican banks, including No. 2 Banorte, by creating phantom orders that wired funds to bogus accounts and promptly withdrew the money.

Fleetcor Technologies, a company specializing in fuel cards and workforce payment products and services, publicly discloses that its gift card systems were accessed last month by an unauthorized party. A "significant number" of gift cards that are at least six months old, as well as PIN numbers, were accessed.
Flexible Benefit Service Corporation notifies 5,123 of a phishing incident occurred on February 16.
Flexible Benefit Service Corporation notifies 5,123 of a phishing incident occurred on February 16.

Users of the popular flight-tracking site flightradar24 are told to change their passwords after the site warns of a data breach. The breach may have compromised the email addresses and hashed passwords for a small subset of Flightradar24 users (those who registered prior to March 16, 2016).

Target: Florida Department Of Agriculture And Consumer Services
Description: Florida officials reveal that hackers may have stolen the names of over 16,000 people who have concealed weapon permits in the state. The breach occurred two weeks ago through its online payment system, which processes payments for customers' permits and other applications.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security
Tags: Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services

Author: $2a$45
Description: Florida Virtual Learning School notifies 368,000 current and former students, after an individual with the moniker $2a$45 uploads information of 35,000 students on a forum. Leon County Schools is among the affected organizations.

Target: Florida'S Agency For Health Care Administration (Fahca)
Description: A phishing attack on an employee at Florida's Agency for Health Care Administration (discovered in November 20, 2017) results in the exposure of sensitive information on 30,000 Medicaid patients.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: Fashion retailer Forever 21 discloses a breach due to an unauthorized access to data from payment cards used at certain of its stores.

Target: Former Tennessee Gov. Phil Bredesen'S Senate Campaign
Description: Former Tennessee Gov. Phil Bredesen's Senate campaign tells the FBI in a letter that it fears it was hacked.

Forrester, one of the world's leading market research and investment advisory firms, admits that a security breach took place during the past week. An unidentified attacker (or attackers) has gained access to the infrastructure hosting its website stealing valid credentials.
Target Class: M Professional Scientific And Technical Activities

Description: Forsyth Public Schools are hit with computer malware causing problems for teachers, students, parents and district administrators.
Several news reports surface of the suspected hacking of player accounts of popular video game Fortnite, with some gamers apparently faced with large credit card charges from fraudulent purchases.
Researchers from Cyren discover Syrk, a ransomware, in disguise of an aimbot cheat tool, targeting Fortnite players
Researchers at Zscaler’s ThreatLabZ discover malicious apps on Google Play, in disguise of a mobile version of the popular game Fortnite.
Malwarebytes reveal the details of a campaign carried on via a fake installer for the famous video game Fortnite.
Tens of thousands of Fortnite users are infected by malware after downloading a fake cheating app.
Hackers break into CCTV systems of at least four British schools and stream footage of pupils live on the internet.
And the list of the victims of the Sabre attack also includes Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts.
Target Class: I Accommodation And Food Service Activities
Tags: Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts, Sabre Hospitality Systems

Target: Four U.S. Pipeline Companies (Oneok Inc, Energy Transfer Partners Lp, Boardwalk Pipeline Partners Lp, Eastern Shore Natural Gas)
Description: At least four U.S. pipeline companies have seen their electronic systems for communicating with customers shut down, with three confirming it resulted from a cyberattack to Latitude Technology, a third-party provider. It is not clear is the outage is the result of a ransomware or DDoS attack.
Target Class: D Electricity Gas Steam And Air Conditioning Supply

Author: People’s Republic of China (PRC)-based actors
Target: Four Western Think Tanks And An Additional Two Non-Governmental Organizations (Ngos).
Description: Crowdstrike reveals the details of espionage-driven targeted attacks carried on by Chinese actors against four Western think tanks and an additional two non-governmental organizations (NGOs).
Target Class: M Professional Scientific And Technical Activities

Author: People’s Republic of China (PRC)-based actors
Target: Four Western Think Tanks And An Additional Two Non-Governmental Organizations (Ngos).
Description: Crowdstrike reveals the details of espionage-driven targeted attacks carried on by Chinese actors against four Western think tanks and an additional two non-governmental organizations (NGOs).
Target Class: U Activities Of Extraterritorial Organizations And Bodies

Description: Dutch security firm Fox-IT reveals to have fallen victim of a DNS Hijacking attack on September 19th 2017. The attacker modifies a DNS record for one particular server to point to a server in their possession and to intercept and forward the traffic to the original server that belongs to Fox-IT.
France's central bank warns of an increase in phishing attempts using its name and logo and email addresses purporting to be Bank of France ones.
A Fredericksburg school system employee falls for phishing attack

An anonymous researcher reveals that the server hosting dozens of free-to-use online file conversion websites, including combinepdf.com, imagetopdf.com, jpg2pdf.com, pdftoimage.com, pdfcompressor.com, and wordtojpeg.com, has been hacked several times in the past year
Tags: combinepdf.com, imagetopdf.com, jpg2pdf.com, pdftoimage.com, pdfcompressor.com, wordtojpeg.com, ImageMagick

Target:
Free Press
 Fight For The Future
Description: The Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) reveals the details of “Phish For The Future,” an advanced persistent spearphishing campaign targeting digital civil liberties activists at Free Press and Fight For the Future discovered between July 7th and August 8th of 2017.
Tags: Electronic Frontier Foundation, EFF, Phish For The Future, Free Press, Fight For the Future

Author: Anonymous
Description: The Anonymous take down Freedom Hosting II, the largest repository of dark web sites. The hackers are able to steal 75GB worth of files and 2.6 GB of databases
Frost Bank investigates a breach after the company discovered unauthorized access to digital images stored in those customers’ commercial image archives.

The Financial Services Information Sharing and Analysis Center (FS-ISAC), an industry forum for sharing data about critical cybersecurity threats facing the banking and finance industries, reveals that a successful phishing attack on one of its employees was used to launch additional phishing attacks against FS-ISAC members.
Anomali finds thousands logins belonging to FTSE 100 companies in the dark web.

An unknown hacker steals user account information (3.3 million records) and alleged product source code from FunPlus, the company that makes highly popular free-to-play mobile game Family Farm Seaside.

Author: Turla
Description: ProofPoint reveals that Turla appears to be actively targeting G20 participants and those interested in its activities including policymakers, member nations and journalists. The analysis is based on the discovery of a new JavaScript dropper for a backdoor called KopiLuwak that Turla has been known to use.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: Video game giant GameStop Corp says it is investigating reports that hackers may have siphoned credit card and customer data from its website gamestop.com.
French domain registrar Gandi loses control over 751 customer domains, which have their DNS records altered to point incoming traffic to websites hosting exploits kits.
A phishing email attack potentially compromises the accounts of as many as 18,000 current and former employees of media company Gannett Co.

Author: Kapustkiy
Description: In a form of protest against President Nicolas Maduro, Kapustkiy hacks a website of a local government and dumps around 900 records on pastebin.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: Reports emerge claiming that GM employees’ names and social security numbers might have been exposed during a breach.
The head of the German military's new cyber command, Lieutenant General Ludwig Leinhos, reveals that army computers were targeted hundreds of thousands of times in the first nine weeks of 2017.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: O2-Telefonica in Germany confirms to Süddeutsche Zeitung that some of its customers have had their bank accounts drained using a two-stage attack that exploits SS7.

Berlin's cyber security watchdog reveals that the German parliament was the target of fresh cyber attacks in January that attempted to piggy-back on an Israeli newspaper site to target politicians in Germany.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: A new ransomware strain called Ordinypt is currently targeting victims in Germany, but instead of encrypting users' documents, the ransomware rewrites files with random data.
German users are hit by a new spam campaign distributing the destructive Ordinypt malware.
German authorities warn about phishing emails trying to take advantage of the Spectre and Meltdown vulnerabilities, promising fake patches and distributing the Smoke Loader malware.

BSI, the Germany's federal cybersecurity agency warns of an active malspam campaign, distributing the Emotet banking Trojan payloads via emails camouflaged to look like messages delivered by several German federal authorities.
The director of the General Confederation of Italian Industry group in Brussels falls victim of an email scam and transfers 500,000 EUR (590,000 USD) to an unknown bank account.
Tags: General Confederation of Italian Industry, Gianfranco Dell'Alba

Description: Security researchers from Qihoo 360 Netlab discover that the operators behind the TheMoon botnet are now leveraging a zero-day exploit to target GPON routers.

Trend Micro researchers detect a new attack mimicking the Mirai botnet modus operandi, originating from Mexico and targeting Gigabit Passive Optical Network (GPON)-based home routers via two vulnerabilities (CVE-2018-10561 and CVE-2018-10562).
GitHub suvives the largest DDoS attack recorded (so far), reching a stunning 1.35 terabits/sec. leveraging memcached servers.

Target: Github Account Of The Gentoo Linux Distribution
Description: An unknown hacker temporarily takes control over the GitHub account of the Gentoo Linux organization and embed malicious code inside the operating system's distributions that would delete user files. The malicious code fails to trigger properly and users' files remain safe.
GitHub users are targeted by a Sawfish phishing campaign designed to steal their GitHub login credentials and time-based one-time password (TOTP) codes.
GitHub issues a security alert warning about Octopus Scanner, a new malware strain that's been spreading on its site via 26 boobytrapped Java projects.
Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal the details of a new campaign targeting developers sharing code on GitHub with a malicious with a stealth malware called Dimnie.
Hackers try to steal 55 million rubles ($940,000) from Russian state bank Globex using the SWIFT international payments messaging system. At the end the hackers only withdraw around $100,000.
A massive phishing campaign hits Google users and compromises about a million of its accounts exploiting a fake app abusing the Oauth authentication protocol.
Researchers from Kaspersky Lab discover a sophisticated cyberattack targeting Gmail users through fraudulent, unsolicited Google Calendar notifications.
Attack: Multiple Attack Vectors (Account Hijacking And Malware)

Description: GMO Payment Gateway confirms data leakage from two client websites, due to the Apache Struts vulnerability. The victims are the Tokyo Metropolitan Government, and the Japan Housing Finance Agency. The total leaked recors are more than 700,000.
Tags: GMO Payment Gateway, Apache Struts, Tokyo Metropolitan Government, Japan Housing Finance Agency

Description: Car-sharing company GoGet discloses a major data breach seven months after it was first detected in June 2017 as the alleged hacker is arrested by Australian police this week. In an email sent to customers, the firm says its IT team identified "unauthorised activity" on its system on 27 June last year and immediately launched a full internal investigation.
Goldon Optometric informs some patients whose information was affected by a CrySiS ransomware attack.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: Goldjoy, another travel agency in Hong Kong, reveals that unauthorised parties accessed its customer database containing personal information such as names and ID card numbers, passport details and phone numbers, asking for a ransom.

Goldjoy, another travel agency in Hong Kong,  reveals that unauthorised parties accessed its customer database containing personal information such as names and ID card numbers, passport details and phone numbers, asking for a ransom.
Comedy and entertainment agency Goliath and Goliath suffered a loss of more than 300,000 ZAR (22,000 USD worth) in what appears to be a phishing scam.
Hackers suspected of breaching a popular South Korean mobile app and stealing the personal data of more than 990,000 are arrested by local police in Korea.

In the wake of the breach occurred to Sabre Hospitality Solutions earlier in May, the personal details of a small number of Google staffers have been exposed, according to a notification letter Google sends out to affected employees.

Author: Evaldas Rimasauskas
Description: Google and Facebook confirm that they fell victim to an alleged $100m (£77m) scam between 2013 and 2015.
Security Expert Brad Duncan spot a new EITest campaign leveraging HoeflerText Popups to target Google Chrome users and push NetSupport Manager RAT or Locky ransomware.
Tags: Brad Duncan, EITest, HoeflerText, Google Chrome, NetSupport Manager RAT, Locky

Description: SafeBrowse, a Chrome browser extension, with over 140,000 users, is found containing a JavaScript Crypto Miner based on Coinhive.

Security researchers from Trend Micro uncover 89 malicious Google Chrome extensions on the official Chrome store that can inject ads, code to secretly mine cryptocurrency, and load a tool to record and replay a person's browsing activities. According to researchers, this collection of extensions affected over 423,000 users and was used to form a new botnet called "Droidclub."

Target: Google News (Via Compromising Of Palate Press And The Boyne City Gazette)
Description: Legitimate news sites listed on Google News replace articles with spam ads for drugs and dating sites. The incident occurred after two online wine magazine (Palate Press and the Boyne City Gazette) were hacked.
Tags: Google News, Palate Press, The Boyne City Gazette

Description: A malvertising campaign exploits ads in Google Search results for Target, redirecting the users to a tach support scam. Apparently a similar campaing has also been carried on for searches related to Walmart.

Target: Google, Facebook, Apple, And Microsoft Users
Description: According to internet monitoring service BGPMon, traffic sent to and from Google, Facebook, Apple, and Microsoft is briefly routed through a previously unknown Russian Internet provider. The hijack lasts a total of six minutes and affects 80 separate address blocks.
Tags: Google, Facebook, Apple, Microsoft, BGP, BGPMon

Author: Kuroi’SH
Description: Kuroi’SH hjacks the DNS record of google.com.br and redirects the users to a defaced page. The hacks happens compromising the records held by registro.br.

Author: Chris Hutcheson
Description: The father-in-law of celebrity chef Gordon Ramsay is jailed for six months after pleading guilty to attempting to hack into his computer to steal financial information and 'dirty' secrets on the star for the hacking plot to crack into Ramsay's private emails following a family falling-out.

Author: Russian state-sponsored actors (Grizzly Steppe)
Target: Government And Private-Sector Organizations, Critical Infrastructure Providers, And The Internet Service Providers (Isps)
Description: The UK NCSC (National Cyber Security Centre), FBI (Federal Bureau of Investigation) and DHS (Department of Homeland Security) issue a joint Technical Alert about malicious cyber activity carried out by the Russian Government. The attackers use compromised routers to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: Russian state-sponsored actors (Grizzly Steppe)
Target: Government And Private-Sector Organizations, Critical Infrastructure Providers, And The Internet Service Providers (Isps)
Description: The UK NCSC (National Cyber Security Centre), FBI (Federal Bureau of Investigation) and DHS (Department of Homeland Security) issue a joint Technical Alert about malicious cyber activity carried out by the Russian Government. The attackers use compromised routers to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: The entire government of Sint Maarten, an independent country within the Kingdom of the Netherlands, is taken down for a week by a cyber attack.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: The entire government of Sint Maarten, an independent country within the Kingdom of the Netherlands, is taken down for a week by a cyber attack.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: Stealth Mango
Target: Government Officials, Members Of The Military, And Activists In Pakistan, Afghanistan, India, Iraq And The United Arab Emirates
Description: Researchers from Lookout discover a phishing campaign that infected Android devices with custom surveillance-ware bent on extracting data from top officials, primarily in the Middle East. The campaign is called Stealth Mango, and has been used to collect over 30 gigabytes of compromised data on attacker infrastructure
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Target: Government Organization In The Middle East
Description: FireEye reveals the details of a new campaign carried on by the suspected Iranian threat group APT34 exploiting the recently patched CVE-2017-11882 exploit.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: Sofacy
Target: Government Organizations Dealing With Foreign Affair
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks Unit 42 reveal the details of Zebrocy, a new campaign carried on by the Sofacy group via phishing attacks that contain malicious Microsoft Office documents with macros as well as simple executable file attachments.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Target: Government Organizations In The Middle East
Description: Malware researchers at Palo Alto Networks spot a new strain of ransomware, dubbed RanRan, that has been used in targeted attacks against government organizations in the Middle East.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Target: Governments And High-Level Officials In The Middle East And North Africa (Mena)
Description: Kaspersky Labs details a large-scale nation-state backed malware campaign called Operation Parliament that is targeting governments and high-level officials in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) regions and more specifically Palestine.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Target: Governments And High-Level Officials In The Middle East And North Africa (Mena)

Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: In his first key interview, Ciaran Martin, head of GCHQ’s new National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC), warns that Britain is being hit by 60 significant cyber-attacks a month, including attempts by Russian state-sponsored hackers to steal defence and foreign policy secrets from government departments.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security
Tags: Ciaran Martin, GCHQ, National Cyber Security Centre, NCSC

Description: Great Western Railway reset more than a million customer accounts after discovering hackers had successfully breached a small percentage of them. According to the operator, about 1,000 of its passengers' details have been exposed.
Greenway Health is the victim of a ransomware attack
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: About 3,300 are affected by a security breach after the school discovers that an unauthorized user logged in to four Greenwood County School District 50 employees’ emails as well as current and former employees’ payroll accounts in January and February.
Grey Eagle Resort and Casino and the attackers threatne to dump hundreds of gigabytes of data. The Casino confirms the breach.
Target Class: I Accommodation And Food Service Activities

Description: Greyhealth Group reveals to have suffered a phishing attack compromising the personal information of 683 individuals.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: A sick hack: hackers take over the email account of Griffin Funeral Home, and send email scams to the company's customers, asking for money.

Author: Tsar Team
Description: Cybercriminals steal 25,000 personal records and photos of patients from the data system of a Lithuanian plastic surgery clinic and put them up for sale.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: Guardian Pharmacy of Jacksonville notifies 11,521 patients of email compromise of protected health information.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: Gwent Police is being investigated after failing to inform up to 450 people that hackers may have accessed their confidential reports to the force.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: Gwent Police is being investigated after failing to inform up to 450 people that hackers may have accessed their confidential reports to the force.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: The Hancock Regional Hospital, in the state of Indiana, confirms to be running on pen and paper following a SAMSAM ransomware attack, which hit the day prior. The hospital eventually pays up hackers $55,000 to restore control.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Author: The Dark Overlord
Description: Hand Rehabilitation Specialists notifies patients of a possible hack by The Dark Overlord occurred back in July.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities
Tags: Hand Rehabilitation Specialists, The Dark Overlord

Description: Tthe popular DVD-ripping HandBrake app, is hacked to installi a new variant of the Proton malware.
A database from the Harare Institute of Technology is leaked, containing 3,500 users.

Another consequence of the Sabre breach, Hard Rock Hotels and & Casinos reveals that for seven months, attackers had unauthorized access to a third-party reservation system, which allowed them to attain unencrypted credit card payment information, as well as guest names, addresses and phone numbers.
Target Class: I Accommodation And Food Service Activities
Tags: Hard Rock Hotels & Casinos, Sabre Hospitality Systems

Description: The HardwareZone (HWZ) Forum website is hacked and approximately 685,000 user profiles are affected. A senior moderator’s account has been compromised by an unidentified hacker, and used to access the user profiles since September 2017.
Harper’s Magazine, the monthly longform journalism and essay publication, warns subscribers that their passwords may have been stolen by hackers.
Harrys County lose almost $900K in a phishing scam. The attack dates back to September 2017.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: Harrys County lose almost $900K in a phishing scam. The attack dates back to September 2017.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: HBO joins the ranks of Hollywood entertainment companies to suffer a major cyber attack. The company network is compromised and the attacker claim to have stolen 1.5 TB of data. Few days after they leak an episode of the new season of Games of Thrones

Health South-East RHF, a healthcare organization that manages hospitals in Norway's southeast region, announces a security breach. A hacker or hacker group might have stolen healthcare data for more than half of Norway's population. (over 2.9 million individuals)
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Author: Orangeworm
Target: Healthcare Organizations In The United States, Europe And Asia
Description: Researchers from Symantec reveal the details of Orangeworm, a threat group targeting healthcare organizations in the United States, Europe and Asia via a custom backdoor dubbed Kwampirs.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Target: Healthcare, Education, Manufacturing And Tech Sectors In The Us And Uk
Description: A new ransomware dubbed Defray is discovered by ProofPoint, going after the healthcare, education, manufacturing and tech sectors in the US and UK.

n intruder accesses the email accounts of two HealthEquity members, exposing protected health information (PHI)/personally identifiable information (PII) of 20,906 subscribers. The breach dates back to September and October, and was discovered on October 5th.
About 23,000 accounts are compromised by a data breach that took place at HealthEquity in April when an employee fell for a phishing scam.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: Roughly 18,500 patients at Henry Ford Health System have possibly had their personal information stolen in a data breach occurred in early October after the email credentials of a group of employees were stolen.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: A key database operated by large South African data centre operator and website hosting service provider Hetzner is compromised, and the company advises clients to change their passwords immediately. Compromised data includes customer and bank account details.
UK firm HIDS4U, warns customers to be wary of phishing emails after it came to light that a database of customers was found on a hacked website.
High Fidelity users receive an e-mail from Philip Rosedale, CEO and founder of the new social VR world, announcing the compromise of a staff email account in late December and Early January.

Target: High-Profile Targets In Russia And Ukraine
Description: Researchers from ESET reveal the details of Invisimole, a campaign active since 2013 targeting entities in Russia and Ukraine.
Someone hacks a highway sign in Arizona and defaces it with 'Hail Hitler' text.
Hill Country Memorial Hospital notifies patients after employee email accessed without authorization
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: HipChat is hacked over the weekend due to a vulnerability in a third-party library. The incident affects a server in the HipChat Cloud web tier, and for a small number of instances (less than 0.05 percent), there's evidence messages and content in rooms may have been accessed.

Hitachi Payments Services confirms that its systems were compromised by a sophisticated malware in mid-2016, that led to one of the biggest cyber security breaches in the country with 3.2 million cards affected.

Author: Todd Davis aka Lifelock
Description: Holland Eye Surgery & Laser Center notifies 42,200 patients about a hack occurred in 2016.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: Researchers unveil the details of a new variant of the Mirai botnet called Satori. The botnet exploits a recently discovered 0-day vulnerability to infect two widely used lines of home and small-office routers even when they're secured.

Author: Akincilar
Description: Turkish hackers from Akincilar launch a new cyber attack against Honda Greece. The automaker’s website in Greece is infiltrated with a message condemning the country for “partnering” with terrorists.

Hong Kong Broadband Network, the city’s second largest fixed-line residential broadband provider, discovers that an inactive customer database has been accessed without authorization. The personal data of some 380,000 customers, including details for more than 40,000 credit cards, are compromised.
Hong Kong's securities regulator says that brokers in the city has suffered major DDoS cyber attacks and warn of possible further incidents across the industry.
Hope Hicks tells the House Intelligence Committee that one of her email accounts was hacked, according to people who were present for her testimony in the panel's Russia probe.

HORNE LLP notifies an incident affecting the security of protected health information of certain Forrest General Hospital patients. On November 1, 2017, the company discovered that the email account of one of its employees was sending phishing emails.

Author: APT28
Description: Researchers from FireEye reveal that APT28 AKA Fancy Bear have been using the infamous Eternal Blue vulnerability in a campaign that targeted people of interest as they connected to hotel Wi-Fi networks.
Tags: FireEye, APT28, Fancy Bear, Eternal Blue

Description: Hotels.com sends an email to some customers advising that their username, password, email address, and the last four digits of stored credit card numbers were potentially stolen last month (between may 22 and 29).
hounddawg.org, a popular torrent tracker is hacked. The attacker claims to have downloaded the entire database and the site source code.
Threat actors target internet accessible HPE Integrated Lights-Out 4 (HPE iLO 4) remote management interfaces with ransomware.
The operators of the world’s largest online poker discussion forum, TwoPlusTwo, confirm that the forum was hacked at some point late in 2016, with the personal data then being offered for sale.

Author: Nexus Zeta
Description: Researchers from Check Point discover a zero-day vulnerability in Huawei home router HG532 and a campaign aimed to exploit this vulnerability to inject the SATORI payload.

Author: JokerStash AKA Fin7 AKA Carbanak
Description: Retailer Hudson's Bay Company discloses that it was the victim of a security breach that compromised data on payment cards used at Saks and Lord & Taylor stores in North America. Millions of cards may have been compromised (5 millions are already offered for sale).

Health insurer Humana notifies an unspecified number of health plan members after detecting and blocking a credential stuffing attack against Humana.com and Go365.com. The attacks took place on June 3 and June 4 from overseas IP addresses.
Target Class: Q Human Health And Social Work Activities

Description: McAfee uncovers Operation Honeybee, a malicious document campaign targeting Humanitarian Aid Groups, using North Korean political topics as bait.

Author: Anonymous
Description: A group claiming to be part of the Anonymous collective defaces Victoria’s Human Rights Commission website (humanrightscommission.vic.gov.au) with a nonsensical message about its social network AnonPlus.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: OurMine
Description: The OurMine collective compromises hundreds of popular Youtube channels.
Hyatt Hotels Corp reveals to have discovered unauthorized access to payment card information at certain Hyatt-managed locations worldwide between March 18, 2017 and July 2, 2017
Target Class: I Accommodation And Food Service Activities

Author: APT28 AKA Fancy Bear
Description: IAAF, the governing body of global athletics says it has suffered a cyber attack that it believes has compromised information about athletes' medical records.
Target Class: U Activities Of Extraterritorial Organizations And Bodies

Description: Ian Balina, a well-known sponsored YouTube blogger is hacked, while streaming, loosing roughly $2 million in tokens.
A hacking incident that occurred on March 12 and March 13 compromised more than 170,000 job-seeker accounts of the Idaho Department of Labor.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: A hack of two email accounts at the Idaho Transportation Department (ITD) potentially exposes the personal information of commercial truckers whose rigs are registered in Idaho, including Social Security and credit card numbers. About 114 individuals are notified.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: A hack of two email accounts at the Idaho Transportation Department (ITD) potentially exposes the personal information of commercial truckers whose rigs are registered in Idaho, including Social Security and credit card numbers. About 114 individuals are notified.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: IHOPTwitter account (@IHOP) is hacked and posts a political tweet against Hillary Clinton.
Target Class: I Accommodation And Food Service Activities
Tags: IHOP, @IHOP, International House of Pancakes, Hillary Clinton

Description: Researchers from F5 discover a massive campaign exploiting an old IIS 6.0 vulnerability (CVE-2017-7269) to mine Electroneum.

Author: AnonPlus
Description: Hackers from AnonPlus deface ilgiornale.it, one of the main newspapers in Italy, with a fake news about Mr. Silvio Berlusconi in jail.

The Illinois Department of Employment Security (Ides) revealed on Friday (24 March) that one of its vendors was hacked, potentially compromising personal information of approximately 1.4 million job seekers in the state.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security
Tags: Illinois Department of Employment Security, Ides

Description: Imgur is notified of a potential security breach that occurred in 2014 and affected the email addresses and passwords of 1.7 million user accounts.

Target: Independent Like The North State Group Forum
Description: An online forum designated for California’s First Congressional District debate was hacked by unknown hackers, who take over the live stream to broadcast gay pornography.

Target: India National Defence Academy (Nda) And National Investigation Agency (Nia)
Description: Indian security forces have been alerted by central intelligence agencies that a WhatsApp virus is threatening to hack into their personal information and banking data.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: India’s City Union Bank reveals that cyber criminals have been able to hack its systems and transfer nearly $2 million through three unauthorized remittances to lenders overseas via the SWIFT financial platform.

Symantec reveals to have identified a sustained cyber spying campaign, likely state-sponsored, against Indian and Pakistani entities involved in regional security issues. The espionage campaign dates back to October 2016.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: A complaint reveals that 1,020 bank accounts in different banks were used by fraudsters to receive money from victim's bank accounts through phishing.
The email of a city-based businessman is hacked and INR12.5 lakh (USD 18,230) stolen and transferred to two bank accounts in China.

Author: Suspected Chinese Hackers
Description: The website of India's Ministry of Defence is defaced by suspected Chinese attackers.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: Suspected Chinese Hackers
Description: The website of India's Ministry of Defence is defaced by suspected Chinese attackers.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Target: Individuals In Russia, Turkey And Ukraine
Description: Microsoft says to have discovered and stopped a large attack that attempted to use variants of the Dofoil, or Smoke Loader, trojan to spread a cryptocurrency miner. In total more than 400,000 instances were recorded: 73 percent, hitting Russians with Turkey,18 percent, and the Ukraine 4 percent being the other main targets. The attack was carried on via an update server that replaced a BitTorrent client called MediaGet with a near-identical but back-doored binary.

Researchers from Abnormal Security discover a malicious campaign where fraudsters are impersonating financial institutions to steal from Americans expecting stimulus checks from the US federal government.
The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) issues a warning about a surge in coronavirus-related scams over email, phone calls, or social media requesting personal information.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a new variant of the NetWire RAT delivered via IRS-themed phishing emails.

Researchers at Bitdefender discover Zacinlo, a newly uncovered form of stealthy and persistent malware distributing adware to victims across the world while also allowing attackers to take screenshots of infected machines' desktops. The vast majority of Zacinlo victims are in the US, with 90 percent of those infected running Microsoft Windows 10.
Researchers from ProofPoint discover a new DanaBot campaign spread through Malspam campaign installing the Hancitor malware.

Author: The Lazarus Group
Target: Individuals Involved With Us Defense Contractors
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal the details of a new operation carried on by the North Korea-linked Lazarus Group against individuals involved with US Defense Contractors.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Target: Individuals Or Organizations Linked To South Korea Or The Video Game Industry.
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks Unit 42 reveal the details of a new remote access Trojan dubbed UBoatRAT, distributed via Google Drive, and targeting individuals or organizations linked to South Korea or the video game industry.
Tags: Palo Alto Networks, Unit 42, UBoatRAT, Google Drive

Description: A vulnerability in Parity's Ethereum wallet software is exploited by thieves to rob victims on a massive scale. Targeted accounts are drained of 150,000 coins worth just over US$30 million at the current price.
And during the same wave of DDoS attacks, also ING is targeted (once again).
During the same weekend, also ING is targeted.
Thousands of Inland Revenue files are locked up after New Zealand’s tax department becomes the target of a Cryptolocker attack in November.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: Thousands of Inland Revenue files are locked up after New Zealand’s tax department becomes the target of a Cryptolocker attack in November.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: Inogen, a California-based medical device manufacturer, reports that 30,000 former and current customers may have had their personal information exposed when a company employee's email account was compromised sometime between Jan. 2, 2018, and Mar. 14, 2018.

Author: AnoaGhost
Description: An NHS website is defaced
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: AnoaGhost
Description: An NHS website is defaced
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: Instagram reveals that one or more hackers have been stealing celebrities' e-mail addresses, phone numbers, and other personal information by exploiting a bug. A database, Doxagram, is published online immediately after with the attacker claiming to have stolen 6 million records. Few

Author: Iron Tiger
Target: Institutions In The Government, Technology, Education And Telecommunications Sector In Asia And The Us.
Description: Security researchers from BitDefender discover a custom-built piece of malware wreaking havoc in Asia for several months that could signal the return of the notorious Chinese hacker group - Iron Tiger. The campaign is called Operation PZChao, and has been targeting institutions in the government, technology, education and telecommunications sector in Asia and the US.

The Internal Revenue Service says that the personal data of as many as 100,000 taxpayers could have been compromised through a scheme in which hackers posed as students using an online tool to apply for financial aid.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: Pawn Storm AKA Fancy Bear AKA APT28
Description: APT28 AKA Pawn Storm AKA Fancy Bear publish a set of apparently stolen emails purportedly belong to officials from the International Olympic Committee, the United States Olympic Committee, and third-party groups associated with the organizations.
Target Class: U Activities Of Extraterritorial Organizations And Bodies

Author: Roaming Mantis
Description: Kaspersky discover that the Roaming Mantis group is testing a new monetization scheme by redirecting iOS users to pages that contain the Coinhive in-browser mining script rather than the normal Apple phishing page.
Malwarebytes reveals the details of a malvertising campaign targeting iOS users delivered via rogue ads on popular torrent sites.
Apple removes two malicious iOS apps (Fitness Balance and Calories Tracker) that tricked users into approving TouchID payments via misleading popups.
Researchers from Wandera discover 17 malicious iPhone apps infected with iOS Clicker. The apps click on adverts secretly, generating income for cyber criminals.
Researchers from Cisco Talos discover a scam group using the recently developed iOS jailbreak dubbed checkra1n, in a campaign designed to help the crooks earn money via click-fraud.
A phony iOS version of Cuphead, a very popular retro game, finds its way into Apple's notoriously restrictive iTunes App store.
Researchers from Google reveal to have detected attacks against iPhone users using two iOS vulnerabilities (CVE-2019-7286 and CVE-2019-7287),  before Apple had a chance to release iOS 12.1.4.

Security researchers from Fortinet spot a new variant of the Mirai malware (dubbed Mirai OMG) that focuses on infecting IoT and networking equipment with the main purpose of turning these devices into a network of proxy servers used to relay malicious traffic.

Security researchers with SecNiche Security Labs discover Gucci, a new IoT botnet that attempts to ensnare Internet of Things (IoT) devices in Europe into a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS)-capable botnet.
Researchers from MalwareMustDie discover a new IoT malware dubbed Linux/AirDropBot

Researchers from cyber-security firm Radware discover a new IoT DDoS botnet, built by San Calvicie, an operator of a gaming server rental business. The botnet is called JenX. The botnets borrows parts of different other IoT botnets (for instance CVE-2014-8361 and CVE-2017–17215).

Author: Nexus Zeta
Description: According to a new report by Newsky Security, the author of the infamous Satori IoT botnet has created two new variants of the predecessor Mirai, called Masuta and PureMasuta.
Bitdefender researchers uncover an emerging IoT botnet that uses advanced communication techniques to exploit victims and build its infrastructure. The bot is dubbed Hide 'N Seek (HNS)
Malicious websites used to generate password details for the fintech network IOTA (online seed generators) are reportedly to blame for the theft of nearly $4m (£2.9m) from users' digital wallets.
Iowa Veterans Home warns nearly 3,000 of data breach after phishing incident
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: Authors from Iran?
Description: Trend Micro reveals the details of Persirai, a new IoT botnet targeting IP cameras.

The Iran Computer Emergency Response Team Coordination Center (Iran CERTCC) issues a security alert about a ransomware distribution campaign currently active in the country, distributing the Tyrant ransomware.
Tags: Iran Computer Emergency Response Team Coordination Center, Iran CERTCC, ransomware, Tyrant

Target: Irinn (Indian Registry For Internet Names And Numbers)
Description: Researchers from Seqrite’s Cyber Intelligence Labs discover 6000 login credentials up for sale on DarkNet, belonging to Indian ISPs, government departments and private businesses. The researchers identify the origin of the breach from the IRINN.
Tags: Seqrite’s Cyber Intelligence Labs, DarkNet, IRINN, Indian Registry for Internet Names and Numbers

Description: Partial social security numbers of more than 1,200 employees at Irvington schools are distributed via email to an unknown number of recipients by an unidentified attacker.

Author: Daeshgram
Description: A group of Iraqi hackers called Daeshgram places pornographic images into the terror group's communication networks in order to mine ISIS credibility.

Author: Belgium
Description: According to the Belgian Police, a cyberattack takes down 26,000 accounts tied to the Islamic State, on social networks, websites and communication channels.
Target Class: U Activities Of Extraterritorial Organizations And Bodies

Author: UK
Description: The director of the intelligence agency GCHQ, Jeremy Fleming reveals that the UK has conducted a "major offensive cyber-campaign" against the Islamic State group.
Islamic State supporters are targeted with a modified version of the Telegram Android app that contains a version of the OmniRAT remote access toolkit.

Author: Iran
Description: Iran indirectly blames Israel for a series of attempted cyber attacks that it says targeted its communication infrastructure over the last few days.

Author: Anonymous
Description: In name of #OpIsrael and #OpUSA, hacktivists from the Anonymous Collective leak online names, emails, and passwords of Israeli public employees and share a list of US government sites to target, calling on action against them.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: Hamas
Description: An Hamas cyber attack causes a retaliation airstrike on the Hamas cyber operations center. There are no details on the cyber attack, which, according to reports, was aimed at "harming the quality of life of Israeli citizens".
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: Two separate papers from Kaspersky and Lookout reveal the details of ViperRAT, an active APT targeting the Israeli Defense Force.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security
Tags: Kaspersky, Lookout, Israeli Defense Force, ViperRat

Author: AnonPlus
Description: The AnonPlus hacker group says they have hacked the Florence branch of the Italian centre-left Democratic Party (PD) and leaked data regarding leader Matteo Renzi online.
Target Class: U Activities Of Extraterritorial Organizations And Bodies

Author: Russian Hackers?
Description: Russia is suspected by Italian officials of being behind a sustained hacking attack against the Italian foreign ministry last year that compromised email communications and lasted for many months before it was detected
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: Anonymous
Description: The Anonymous collective publishes some internal document stolen from the email accounts of some government employees.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: The Italian branch of the Anonymous collective leaks from the Italian Ministry of Education, 26,000 emails of teachers belonging to all level of schools. They also leak 200 administrative staff addresses.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: The Italian branch of the Anonymous collective leaks from the Italian Ministry of Education, 26,000 emails of teachers belonging to all level of schools. They also leak 200 administrative staff addresses.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: An in-development home made ransomware named J. Sterling Ransomware is discovered. This ransomware strain targets the high school students of the J. Sterling Morton school district in Cicero, Illinois by pretending to be a student survey.
Tags: J. Sterling Morton school district, ransomware

Description: The Jabbim Instant Messaging service is hacked and the database (8gb) is dumped in the dark web.
The Japanese government’s cybersecurity center reveals that the email addresses and passwords of thousands of ministry employees have been leaked and are being sold on the Internet.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: The Japanese government’s cybersecurity center reveals that the email addresses and passwords of thousands of ministry employees have been leaked and are being sold on the Internet.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Description: Researchers from Cyberseason reveal the details of a long-lasting campaign against Japanese companies using the ransomware/wiper ONI.
Cylance discovers Snake Wine another prolonged campaign that appears to exclusively target Japanese companies and individuals.

Author: APT10
Description: According to FireEye, the Chinese group APT10 has targeted Japanese defense companies, possibly to get information on Tokyo’s policy toward resolving the North Korean nuclear impasse.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security

Author: APT10
Description: According to FireEye, the Chinese group APT10 has targeted Japanese defense companies, possibly to get information on Tokyo’s policy toward resolving the North Korean nuclear impasse.
Target Class: O Public Administration And Defence, Compulsory Social Security
